title: Trelliscopejs Display for Multiple Imputation Diagnostics
code: trellis_vismi(data = newborn, imp_list = imp_newborn, marginal_x = "box+rug")

title: Trelliscopejs Display for Multiple Imputation Diagnostics
code: obj <- overimp(data = newborn, p = 0.2, m = 5, test_ratio = 0.2,     method = "mixgb") trellis_vismi_overimp(obj = obj, stack_y = TRUE)

title: Trelliscopejs Display for Multiple Imputation Diagnostics
code: library(mixgb) set.seed(2026) mixgb_obj <- mixgb(data = newborn, m = 5, maxit = 5, save.models = TRUE) trellis_vismi_converge(obj = mixgb_obj) library(mice) set.seed(2026) mice_obj <- mice(data = newborn, m = 5, maxit = 5, printFlag = FALSE) trellis_vismi_converge(obj = mice_obj)

what: Obtain imputation objects from mice and mixgb
title: Convergence Diagnostics for Multiple Imputation
text: demonstration, use newborn dataset included vismi package. incomplete dataset missing values variables various types. first obtain imputation objects mice mixgb packages 5 multiple imputations (m = 5) 10 iterations (maxit = 10).    Convergence diagnostic mixgb object use vismi_converge() mixgb object, users required set save.models = TRUE mixgb() intermediate summary statistics imputations saved iteration plotting convergence diagnostics.
code: library(vismi) library(mice) library(mixgb)   set.seed(2026) mice_obj <- mice(data = newborn, m = 5, maxit = 30, printFlag = FALSE) mixgb_obj <- mixgb(data = newborn, m = 5, maxit = 30, save.models = TRUE) mixgb_pmm_obj <- mixgb(data = newborn, m = 5, maxit = 30, pmm.type = "auto",     save.models = TRUE) vismi_converge(obj = mice_obj, x = "recumbent_length_cm", tick_vals = NULL,     linewidth = 0.5, mean_lim = c(68, 70.5), sd_lim = c(3, 8)) vismi_converge(obj = mixgb_pmm_obj, x = "recumbent_length_cm",     tick_vals = NULL, linewidth = 0.5, mean_lim = c(68, 70.5),     sd_lim = c(3, 8)) vismi_converge(obj = mixgb_obj, x = "recumbent_length_cm", tick_vals = NULL,     linewidth = 0.5, mean_lim = c(68, 70.5), sd_lim = c(3, 8))

what: Visualise convergence diagnostic for mice object
title: Convergence Diagnostics for Multiple Imputation
code: vismi_converge(obj = mice_obj, x = "recumbent_length_cm", tick_vals = NULL,     linewidth = 0.5, mean_lim = c(68, 70.5), sd_lim = c(3, 8))

what: Visualise convergence diagnostic for mixgb object (with PMM)
title: Convergence Diagnostics for Multiple Imputation
code: vismi_converge(obj = mixgb_pmm_obj, x = "recumbent_length_cm",     tick_vals = NULL, linewidth = 0.5, mean_lim = c(68, 70.5),     sd_lim = c(3, 8))

what: Visualise convergence diagnostic for mixgb object (without PMM)
title: Convergence Diagnostics for Multiple Imputation
text: Convergence diagnostic mixgb object use vismi_converge() mixgb object, users required set save.models = TRUE mixgb() intermediate summary statistics imputations saved iteration plotting convergence diagnostics.
code: vismi_converge(obj = mixgb_obj, x = "recumbent_length_cm", tick_vals = NULL,     linewidth = 0.5, mean_lim = c(68, 70.5), sd_lim = c(3, 8))

title: Distributional Characteristics for Multiple Imputation
text: vignette demonstrates use vismi() function vismi package visualise compare distributional characteristics observed imputed data. vismi() function can automatically generate suitable static interactive visualisations one, two, three variables, can numeric factor (categorical) variables. verbose = TRUE, vismi() print following information console: Sanity checks: includes sanity check input data different types variables treated plotting. Missing data summary: provides summary number missing values variable interest (variables specified x, y, z arguments). Breakdown missing data patterns summary shows breakdown missingness patterns across variables interest (x, y, z). example, among head_circumference_cm, weight_kg, sex, 13 observations missing head_circumference_cm, 6 observations missing weight_kg, 111 observations missing head_circumference_cm weight_kg. Imputed data visualisation section reports number target observations least one missing value variables interest (x, y, z). post-imputed values target observations shown m imputation panels vismi() output. can compare observed data panel. Users need provide following inputs vismi(): data: original incomplete dataset (data frame tibble data table). imp_list: list imputed datasets (list data frames tibbles data tables). can obtained using mixgb() mixgb package, mice() mice package imputation method generates multiple imputed datasets list. x, y, z : variable names (strings) visualised. x required, y z optional. Depending number variables provided, vismi() generate suitable visualisations. interactive: logical argument indicating whether generate interactive plot (built plotly) static plot (built ggplot2). Default FALSE (static plot). arguments: users can pass different plot settings. See documentation vismi() details.
code: library(vismi) vismi(data = newborn, imp_list = imp_newborn, x = "head_circumference_cm",     y = "weight_kg", z = "sex", verbose = TRUE) #>  #> ── Sanity checks ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> ℹ `household_size`: integer variable detected; treated as numeric for plotting. #> ℹ `age_months`: integer variable detected; treated as numeric for plotting. #> ℹ `health`: ordered factor detected; treated as factor for plotting. #>  #> ── Missing data summary ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Variable `head_circumference_cm` has 124 missing values. #> Variable `weight_kg` has 117 missing values. #> Variable `sex` has 0 missing values. #>  #>  #> ── Breakdown of missing data patterns ────────────────────────────────────────── #>                                Variable Count #> 1                 head_circumference_cm    13 #> 2                             weight_kg     6 #> 3                                   sex     0 #> 4      head_circumference_cm, weight_kg   111 #> 5            head_circumference_cm, sex     0 #> 6                        weight_kg, sex     0 #> 7 head_circumference_cm, weight_kg, sex     0 #>  #> ── Imputed data visualisation ────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> For each imputed set, a total of 130 observations with missingness in the #> specified variable `head_circumference_cm`, `weight_kg`, and `sex` are shown.

title: Overimputation Diagnostics for Multiple Imputation
text: demonstration, use newborn dataset included vismi package. incomplete dataset missing values variables various types. can obtain overimputation object 5 multiple imputations (m = 5), extra missing values proportion 20% (p = 0.2) test set ratio 20% (test_ratio = 0.2). Imputation method can set "mixgb" "mice", call mixgb() mice backend. Users can also pass additional argument related mixgb() mice() overimp(). setting, 20% extra missing values introduced data split training data (80%) test data (20%). imputation model built using training data, used impute extra missing values training data test data.
code: library(vismi) obj <- overimp(data = newborn, m = 5, p = 0.2, test_ratio = 0.2,     method = "mixgb", pmm.type = "auto")

title: Overimputation Diagnostics for Multiple Imputation
text: options numeric variable include: cv, density, ridge, qq, qqline.      options factor variable include: cv, bar, dodge.
code: vismi_overimp(obj = obj, x = "head_circumference_cm", num_plot = "cv") vismi_overimp(obj = obj, x = "head_circumference_cm", num_plot = "density") vismi_overimp(obj = obj, x = "head_circumference_cm", num_plot = "ridge") vismi_overimp(obj = obj, x = "head_circumference_cm", num_plot = "qq") vismi_overimp(obj = obj, x = "head_circumference_cm", num_plot = "qqline") vismi_overimp(obj = obj, x = "ethnicity", fac_plot = "cv") vismi_overimp(obj = obj, x = "ethnicity", fac_plot = "cv", stack_y = TRUE) vismi_overimp(obj = obj, x = "ethnicity", fac_plot = "cv", stack_y = TRUE,     diag_color = "white") vismi_overimp(obj = obj, x = "health", fac_plot = "bar") vismi_overimp(obj = obj, x = "health", fac_plot = "dodge") vismi_overimp(obj = obj, x = "head_circumference_cm", y = "recumbent_length_cm") vismi_overimp(obj = obj, y = "sex", x = "head_circumference_cm",     alpha = 0.5, point_size = 0.2, boxpoints = "all") vismi_overimp(obj = obj, x = "health", y = "sex")

title: Overimputation Diagnostics for Multiple Imputation
text: options numeric variable include: cv, density, ridge, qq, qqline.      options factor variable include: cv, bar, dodge.

code: @Manual{,   title = {vismi: Visual Diagnostics for Multiple Imputation},   author = {Yongshi Deng and Thomas Lumley},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.9.3},   url = {https://github.com/agnesdeng/vismi}, }

title: Visual Diagnostics for Multiple Imputation
text: R package vismi (Visual Diagnostics Multiple Imputation) provides comprehensive suite visual diagnostics assessing quality multiply imputed data. package supports imputed data generated various multiple imputation methods, including mixgb, mice, .

title: Visual Diagnostics for Multiple Imputation
text: package completely redesigned. Please check Articles section details. vismi(): visualise multiply-imputed missing data distributional characteristics vismi_overimp(): visualise multiply-imputed missing data overimputation vismi_converge(): visualise convergence diagnostics imputed values incomplete variable support trelliscopejs, vismi provides trelliscope displays inspect variables via trellis_vismi() trellis_vismi_overimp() trellis_vismi_converge()

title: Visual Diagnostics for Multiple Imputation
text: can install current development version vismi GitHub :
code: devtools::install_github("agnesdeng/vismi")

what: Precomputed mixgb imputed datasets for `newborn` — imp_newborn

text: small precomputed list object containing `m` imputed datasets generated `mixgb::mixgb()` `newborn` example data. dataset included users can run plotting examples without installing `mixgb`.

title: Precomputed mixgb imputed datasets for `newborn` — imp_newborn
code: data(imp_newborn)

title: Precomputed mixgb imputed datasets for `newborn` — imp_newborn
text: list `m` data.frames (completed dataset) created   `mixgb::mixgb()` development.

title: Precomputed mixgb imputed datasets for `newborn` — imp_newborn
text: Generated package development `mixgb::mixgb()`.

title: NHANES III (1988-1994) newborn data — newborn
text: dataset extracted NHANES III (1988-1994) age class Newborn (1 year). Please note example dataset contains selected variables demonstration purposes .

title: NHANES III (1988-1994) newborn data — newborn
code: data(newborn)

title: NHANES III (1988-1994) newborn data — newborn
text: data frame 2107 rows 16 variables, adapted NHANES III dataset. Nine variables contain missing values. Variable names factor levels renamed clarity easier interpretation. household_size Household size. integer variable ranging 1 10. original variable name NHANES III dataset HSHSIZER. age_months Age interview (screener), months. integer variable ranging 2 11. original variable name NHANES III dataset HSAGEIR. sex Sex subject. factor variable levels Male Female. original variable name NHANES III dataset HSSEX. race Race subject. factor variable levels White, Black, . original variable name NHANES III dataset DMARACER. ethnicity Ethnicity subject. factor variable levels Mexican-American, Hispanic, Hispanic. original variable name NHANES III dataset DMAETHNR. race_ethinicity Combined race–ethnicity classification. factor variable levels Non-Hispanic White, Non-Hispanic Black, Mexican-American, . original variable name NHANES III dataset DMARETHN. head_circumference_cm Head circumference, centimetres. Numeric. original variable name NHANES III dataset BMPHEAD. recumbent_length_cm Recumbent length, centimetres. Numeric. original variable name NHANES III dataset BMPRECUM. first_subscapular_skinfold_mm First subscapular skinfold thickness, millimetres. Numeric. original variable name NHANES III dataset BMPSB1. second_subscapular_skinfold_mm Second subscapular skinfold thickness, millimetres. Numeric. original variable name NHANES III dataset BMPSB2. first_triceps_skinfold_mm First triceps skinfold thickness, millimetres. Numeric. original variable name NHANES III dataset BMPTR1. second_triceps_skinfold_mm Second triceps skinfold thickness, millimetres. Numeric. original variable name NHANES III dataset BMPTR2. weight_kg Body weight, kilograms. Numeric. original variable name NHANES III dataset BMPWT. poverty_income_ratio Poverty income ratio. Numeric. original variable name NHANES III dataset DMPPIR. smoke Whether anyone living household smokes cigarettes inside home. factor variable levels Yes . original variable name NHANES III dataset HFF1. health General health status subject. ordered factor levels Excellent, Good, Good, Fair, Poor. original variable name NHANES III dataset HYD1.

title: NHANES III (1988-1994) newborn data — newborn
text: https://wwwn.cdc.gov/nchs/nhanes/nhanes3/datafiles.aspx

title: NHANES III (1988-1994) newborn data — newborn
text: U.S. Department Health Human Services (DHHS).  National Center Health Statistics.  Third National Health Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES III, 1988-1994): Multiply Imputed Data Set. CD-ROM, Series 11, . 7A. Hyattsville, MD: Centers Disease Control Prevention, 2001. Includes access software: Adobe Systems, Inc. Acrobat Reader version 4.

what: Trelliscope Visualisation of Distributional Characteristics — trellis_vismi
title: Trelliscope Visualisation of Distributional Characteristics — trellis_vismi
text: Generates Trelliscope display distributional characteristics across variables.

title: Trelliscope Visualisation of Distributional Characteristics — trellis_vismi
code: trellis_vismi(   data,   imp_list,   m = NULL,   imp_idx = NULL,   integerAsFactor = FALSE,   title = "auto",   subtitle = "auto",   color_pal = NULL,   marginal_x = "box+rug",   verbose = FALSE,   nrow = 2,   ncol = 4,   path = NULL,   ... )

title: Trelliscope Visualisation of Distributional Characteristics — trellis_vismi
text: data data frame containing original data missing values. imp_list list imputed data frames. m integer specifying number imputed datasets plot. smaller length(imp_list). Default NULL (plot ). imp_idx vector integers specifying indices imputed datasets plot. Default NULL (plot ). integerAsFactor logical value indicating whether treat integer variables factors (TRUE) numeric (FALSE). Default FALSE. title string specifying title plot. Default "auto" (automatic title based x,y,z input). NULL, title shown. subtitle string specifying subtitle plot. Default "auto" (automatic subtitle based x,y,z input). NULL, subtitle shown. color_pal named vector colors different imputation sets. NULL (default), default color palette used. marginal_x character string specifying type marginal plot add x variable 2D plots. Options "hist", "box", "rug", "box+rug", NULL (default, marginal plot) interactive = TRUE. Options "box", "rug", "box+rug", NULL (default, marginal plot) interactive = FALSE. verbose logical value indicating whether print extra information. Default TRUE. nrow Number rows Trelliscope display. Default 2. ncol Number columns Trelliscope display. Default 4. path Optional path save Trelliscope display. NULL, display saved disk. ... Additional arguments passed underlying plotting functions, point_size, alpha, nbins, width, boxpoints.

title: Trelliscope Visualisation of Distributional Characteristics — trellis_vismi
text: Trelliscope display object visualising distributional characteristics variables.

title: Trelliscope Visualisation of Distributional Characteristics — trellis_vismi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ trellis_vismi(data = newborn, imp_list = imp_newborn, marginal_x = "box+rug") } # }

title: Trelliscope Visualisation of Convergence Diagnostics — trellis_vismi_converge
text: obj object class 'mixgb' 'mids' containing intermediate imputed result iteration. tick_vals numeric vector specifying tick values x-axis (iterations). NULL, default tick values used. color_pal vector colors use imputation lines. NULL, default colors used. title string specifying title plot. NULL, title shown. "auto", title generated based input. Default "auto". subtitle string specifying subtitle plot. NULL, subtitle shown. "auto", title generated based input. Default "auto". nrow Number rows Trelliscope display. Default 2. ncol Number columns Trelliscope display. Default 4. path Optional path save Trelliscope display. NULL, display saved disk. ... Additional arguments customize Trelliscope display.

title: Trelliscope Visualisation of Convergence Diagnostics — trellis_vismi_converge

title: Trelliscope Visualisation of Convergence Diagnostics — trellis_vismi_converge
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(mixgb) set.seed(2026) mixgb_obj <- mixgb(data = newborn, m = 5, maxit = 5, pmm.type = "auto", save.models = TRUE) trellis_vismi_converge(obj = mixgb_obj) } # }

code: trellis_vismi_overimp(   obj,   m = NULL,   imp_idx = NULL,   integerAsFactor = FALSE,   title = "auto",   subtitle = "auto",   num_plot = "cv",   fac_plot = "cv",   train_color_pal = NULL,   test_color_pal = NULL,   stack_y = FALSE,   diag_color = "white",   seed = 2025,   nrow = 2,   ncol = 4,   path = NULL,   ... )

title: Trelliscope Visualisation of Overimputation Diagnostics — trellis_vismi_overimp
text: obj object class 'overimp' containing imputed datasets parameters. m single positive integer specifying number imputed datasets plot. smaller total number imputed datasets object. Default NULL ( plot ). imp_idx vector integers specifying indices imputed datasets plot. Default NULL (plot ). integerAsFactor logical indicating whether integer variables treated factors. Default FALSE (treated numeric). title string specifying title plot. Default "auto" (automatic title). NULL, title shown. subtitle string specifying subtitle plot. Default "auto" (automatic subtitle). NULL, subtitle shown. num_plot character string specifying type plot numeric variables. Options "cv" (cross-validation), "ridge", "density". Default "cv". fac_plot character string specifying type plot categorical variables. Options "cv" (cross-validation), "bar", "dodge". Default "cv". train_color_pal vector colors training data. NULL, default colors used. test_color_pal vector colors test data. NULL, default colors used. stack_y logical indicating whether stack y-values plots. Default FALSE. diag_color color specification diagonal line plots. Default NULL. seed integer seed reproducibility. Default 2025. nrow Number rows Trelliscope display. Default 2. ncol Number columns Trelliscope display. Default 4. path Optional path save Trelliscope display. NULL, display saved disk. ... Additional arguments customize plots, point_size, xlim, ylim.

title: Trelliscope Visualisation of Overimputation Diagnostics — trellis_vismi_overimp
text: Trelliscope display object visualising overimputation diagnostics variables.

title: Trelliscope Visualisation of Overimputation Diagnostics — trellis_vismi_overimp
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ obj <- overimp(data = newborn, p = 0.2, m = 5, test_ratio = 0.2, method = "mixgb") trellis_vismi_overimp(obj = obj, stack_y = TRUE) } # }

what: vismi: Visual Diagnostics for Multiple Imputation — vismi-package
title: vismi: Visual Diagnostics for Multiple Imputation — vismi-package
text: comprehensive suite static interactive visual diagnostics assessing quality multiply-imputed data obtained packages 'mixgb' 'mice'. package supports inspection distributional characteristics, diagnostics based masking observed values comparing re-imputed values, convergence diagnostics.

title: vismi: Visual Diagnostics for Multiple Imputation — vismi-package
text: Yongshi Deng, Thomas Lumley. (2026), vismi: Visual Diagnostics Multiple Imputation, R package version 0.9.3

title: vismi: Visual Diagnostics for Multiple Imputation — vismi-package
text: Maintainer: Yongshi Deng agnes.yongshideng@gmail.com (ORCID) contributors: Thomas Lumley t.lumley@auckland.ac.nz [thesis advisor]

what: Visualise Multiple Imputations Through Distributional Characteristics — vismi
title: Visualise Multiple Imputations Through Distributional Characteristics — vismi
text: function provides visual diagnostic tools assessing multiply imputed datasets created 'mixgb' imputers inspecting distributional characteristics imputed variables. supports 1D, 2D, 3D visualisations numeric categorical variables using either interactive static plots.

title: Visualise Multiple Imputations Through Distributional Characteristics — vismi
code: vismi(   data,   imp_list,   x = NULL,   y = NULL,   z = NULL,   m = NULL,   imp_idx = NULL,   interactive = FALSE,   integerAsFactor = FALSE,   title = "auto",   subtitle = "auto",   color_pal = NULL,   marginal_x = "box+rug",   marginal_y = NULL,   verbose = FALSE,   ... )

title: Visualise Multiple Imputations Through Distributional Characteristics — vismi
text: data data frame containing original data missing values. imp_list list imputed data frames. x character string specifying name variable plot x axis. Default NULL. y character string specifying name variable plot y axis. Default NULL. z character string specifying name variable plot z axis. Default NULL. m integer specifying number imputed datasets plot. smaller length(imp_list). Default NULL (plot ). imp_idx vector integers specifying indices imputed datasets plot. Default NULL (plot ). interactive logical value indicating whether create interactive plotly plot (TRUE default) static ggplot2 plot (FALSE). integerAsFactor logical value indicating whether treat integer variables factors (TRUE) numeric (FALSE). Default FALSE. title string specifying title plot. Default "auto" (automatic title based x,y,z input). NULL, title shown. subtitle string specifying subtitle plot. Default "auto" (automatic subtitle based x,y,z input). NULL, subtitle shown. color_pal named vector colors different imputation sets. NULL (default), default color palette used. marginal_x character string specifying type marginal plot add x variable 2D plots. Options "hist", "box", "rug", "box+rug"(default), NULL interactive = TRUE. Options "box", "rug", "box+rug"(default), NULL interactive = FALSE. marginal_y character string specifying type marginal plot add y variable 2D plots. Options "hist", "box", "rug", "box+rug", NULL (default, marginal plot) interactive = TRUE. Options "box", "rug", "box+rug", NULL (default, marginal plot) interactive = FALSE. verbose logical value indicating whether print extra information. Default FALSE. ... Additional arguments passed underlying plotting functions, point_size, alpha, nbins, width, boxpoints.

title: Visualise convergence diagnostics — vismi_converge
text: obj 'mixgb' object returned mixgb() function 'mids' object returned mice() function. x name variable plot convergence . xlim Optional numeric vector length 2 specifying x-axis limits iterations. mean_lim Optional numeric vector length 2 specifying y-axis limits mean values variable. sd_lim Optional numeric vector length 2 specifying y-axis limits standard deviation values variable. title string specifying title plot. NULL, title shown. "auto", title generated based input. Default "auto". subtitle string specifying subtitle plot. NULL, subtitle shown. "auto", title generated based input. Default "auto". tick_vals Optional numeric vector specifying x-axis tick values iterations. color_pal vector m color codes (e.g., hex codes). NULL, default colors used. linewidth line width plot lines. Default 0.8. ... Additional arguments.

title: Visualise convergence diagnostics — vismi_converge
text: ggplot2 object showing convergence plot specified variable.

title: Visualise convergence diagnostics — vismi_converge
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(mixgb) set.seed(2026) mixgb_obj <- mixgb(data = newborn, m = 5, maxit = 5, pmm.type = "auto", save.models = TRUE) vismi_converge(obj = mixgb_obj, x = "recumbent_length_cm") } # }

Default FALSE (treated numeric). title string specifying title plot. Default "auto" (automatic title based x,y,z input). NULL, title shown. subtitle string specifying subtitle plot. Default "auto" (automatic subtitle based x,y,z input). NULL, subtitle shown. num_plot character string specifying type plot numeric variables. fac_plot character string specifying type plot categorical variables. train_color_pal vector colors training data. NULL, default colors used. test_color_pal vector colors test data. NULL, default colors used. stack_y logical indicating whether stack y values certain plots. title: vismi 0.9.3
text: Edited Description file pass CRAN submission checks. Edited examples order reduce running time pass CRAN submission checks.

title: vismi 0.9.2
text: Provide customisable title subtitle via title subtitle arguments main functions. default, uses automatic titles based selected variables. Can set NULL remove titles. Apply default aesthetics settings globally visualisations consistent appearance.

title: vismi 0.9.1
text: Resolved issue overlapping x-axis titles interactive visualisations. Fixed missing legends certain imputed sets contained data points.

title: vismi 0.9.1
text: Adjusted title alignment interactive visualisations using plotly match static version ggplot2 style. Ensure display factor levels consistent manner Moved axis titles font size colour settings default_aesthetics function simplify future customisation maintenance. Change default color palette vismi_palette.

title: vismi 0.9.0
text: Convergence diagnostics visualisation converge() function. Convergence diagnostics trelliscope display converge_trelliscope() function.

title: vismi 0.8.1
text: x-axis title legend items left right axis titles subplots

title: vismi 0.8.0
text: Support static visualisation 3 numeric variables 3 factor variables vismi.data.frame() method. Support interactive visualisation 3 factor variables vismi.data.frame() method. Added verbose argument print missing data summary ### Refactoring Validation checks Aesthetics panel labels titles

title: vismi 0.7.0
text: Deprecated trelliscopejs_con() trelliscopejs_cat(). ### New Features ts_overimp() Support showing overimputation 1D plots numeric factors variables trelliscopejs

title: vismi 0.6.0
text: subset imputed datasets plotting via imp_idx m argument vismi() function. ### Bug Fixes Misalignment issue using plotly subplots .plotly_box_facet(). ### Refactoring Refactored functions.

title: vismi 0.5.0
text: Refactored overimputation visualisation functions 1D & 2D. overimpute() function refactored improve code readability maintainability. Added S3 methods visualising overimputation object. vismi(data, imp_list, x, y, z,...) visualises multiple imputed datasets 3 variables. vismi(obj, x, y, z,...) visualises overimputation results

title: vismi 0.4.0
